title: If Raju purchased 10 dozens of eggs for Rs. 12.50 a dozen, with 5 eggs broken, which he sold at Rs. 1 each, what is the percentage of his profit or loss? - Quora

response.answer_text: CP of 1 dozen  ₹12.5 CP of 10 dozens  ₹125 No. of eggs in 10 dozens  120 Now, 5 eggs are broken. So, he sold 115 eggs each at ₹1. So, total SP  ₹115 Clearly, he incurred loss in the transaction, a loss of 125–115  ₹10. So, loss percentage  (10÷125)×100  1000÷125  8%

10 Dozen = 10x12 = 120 Eggs Purchase Price = 12.50 Per Dozen Purchase Price of 10 Dozen (Total) = 10x12.50 = Rs. 125.0 Now, Purchase Price (Total) = 120 Eggs at Rs. 125 Total Remaining Eggs = Total 120 - 5 Broken Eggs = 115 Eggs Selling Price (Total) = 115 Eggs at Rs. 1 each = Rs. 115 It's a LOSS (Rs. 10 Loss) LOSS (%) PERCENTAGE = (Loss/Cost Price) x 100 = (10/125)x100 = 8 ANSWER = LOSS of 8%
